path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT
name: US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Congress (70)
name: [usgovmanual] Congress (70)
usgovmanual_category: Legislative Branch
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Congress of the United States was created by Article I, section 1, of the Constitution, adopted by the Constitutional Convention on September 17, 1787, providing that â€œAll legislative Powers herein granted shall be vested in a Congress of the United States, which shall consist of a Senate and House of Representatives."
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_1_: New York ratified the Constitution on July 26, 1788, but did not elect its Senators until July 15 and 16, 1789. North Carolina did not ratify the Constitution until November 21, 1789; Rhode Island ratified it on May 29, 1790.
The first Congress under the Constitution met on March 4, 1789, in the Federal Hall in New York City. The membership then consisted of 20 Senators and 59 Representatives.*

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Architect of the Capitol (73)
name: [usgovmanual] Architect of the Capitol (73)
usgovmanual_category: Legislative Branch
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Architect of the Capitol maintains the U.S. Capitol and the buildings and grounds of the Capitol campus.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Congressional Budget Office (79)
name: [usgovmanual] Congressional Budget Office (79)
usgovmanual_category: Legislative Branch
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Congressional Budget Office independently analyzes budgetary and economic issues to support the congressional budget process.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Government Accountability Office (75)
name: [usgovmanual] Government Accountability Office (75)
usgovmanual_category: Legislative Branch
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Government Accountability Office helps the Congress fulfill its constitutional responsibilities and heightens the Federal Government's accountability and performance.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Government Publishing Office (76)
name: [usgovmanual] Government Publishing Office (76)
usgovmanual_category: Legislative Branch
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Government Publishing Office produces, procures, and disseminates printed and electronic publications of the Congress, executive departments, and Federal agencies and establishments

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Library of Congress (77)
name: [usgovmanual] Library of Congress (77)
usgovmanual_category: Legislative Branch
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Library of Congress is the national library of the United States, offering diverse materials for research, including the world's most extensive collections in areas such as American history, music, and law.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] United States Botanic Garden (74)
name: [usgovmanual] United States Botanic Garden (74)
usgovmanual_category: Legislative Branch
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The United States Botanic Garden demonstrates the essential contribution that plants make aesthetically, culturally, ecologically, economically, and therapeutically, to the well-being of humankind, and it supports partnerships, nationally and internationally, by fostering exchanges of information and ideas.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] The Supreme Court of the United States (80)
name: [usgovmanual] The Supreme Court of the United States (80)
usgovmanual_category: Judicial Branch
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: Article III, section 1, of the Constitution of the United States provides that "[t]he judicial Power of the United States, shall be vested in one supreme Court, and in such inferior Courts as the Congress may from time to time ordain and establish."
usgovmanual_name: The Supreme Court of the United States

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Lower Courts (81)
name: [usgovmanual] Lower Courts (81)
usgovmanual_category: Judicial Branch

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Special Courts (88)
name: [usgovmanual] Special Courts (88)
usgovmanual_category: Judicial Branch

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Administrative Office of the United States Courts (93)
name: [usgovmanual] Administrative Office of the United States Courts (93)
usgovmanual_category: Judicial Branch
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Administrative Office of the United States Courts supports and serves the nonjudicial, administrative business of the United States Courts.
usgovmanual_name: Administrative Office of the United States Courts

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Federal Judicial Center (94)
name: [usgovmanual] Federal Judicial Center (94)
usgovmanual_category: Judicial Branch
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Federal Judicial Center is the judicial branch's agency for policy research and continuing education.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] United States Sentencing Commission (95)
name: [usgovmanual] United States Sentencing Commission (95)
usgovmanual_category: Judicial Branch
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The United States Sentencing Commission develops sentencing guidelines and policies for the Federal court system.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] The President (96)
name: [usgovmanual] The President (96)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: The President

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] The Vice President (97)
name: [usgovmanual] The Vice President (97)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: The President

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] The Executive Office of the President (98)
name: [usgovmanual] The Executive Office of the President (98)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: The President
usgovmanual_name: The Executive Office of the President

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Department of Agriculture (322)
name: [usgovmanual] Department of Agriculture (322)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Departments
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Department of Agriculture develops agricultural markets, fights hunger and malnutrition, conserves natural resources, and ensures food quality standards.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Department of Commerce (113)
name: [usgovmanual] Department of Commerce (113)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Departments
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Department of Commerce promotes the Nation's domestic and international trade, economic growth, and technological advancement by fostering free enterprise worldwide, supporting fair trade, compiling social and economic statistics, protecting Earth's physical resources, granting patents and registering trademarks, and assisting small and minority-owned businesses.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Department of Defense (114)
name: [usgovmanual] Department of Defense (114)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Departments
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Department of Defense provides the military forces needed to deter war and protect national security. Under the President, the Secretary of Defense directs and exercises authority and control over the separately organized Departments of the Air Force, the Army, and the Navy; over the Joint Chiefs of Staff; over the combatant commands; and over defense agencies and field activities.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Department of Education (115)
name: [usgovmanual] Department of Education (115)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Departments
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Department of Education ensures equal access to education; promotes educational excellence; and administers, coordinates, and makes policy for most Federal assistance to education with the aim of raising levels of student achievement and readiness for the global future.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Department of Energy (116)
name: [usgovmanual] Department of Energy (116)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Departments
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Department of Energy addresses the Nation's energy, environmental, and nuclear challenges, using transformative science and technology to ensure national security and prosperity.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Department of Health and Human Services (117)
name: [usgovmanual] Department of Health and Human Services (117)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Departments
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Department of Health and Human Services strengthens the public health and welfare of the American people by making affordable and quality health care and childcare accessible, ensuring the safety of food products, preparing for public health emergencies, and advancing the diagnosis, treatment, and curing of life-threatening illnesses.
usgovmanual_name: Department of Health and Human Services

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Department of Homeland Security (118)
name: [usgovmanual] Department of Homeland Security (118)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Departments
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Department of Homeland Security prevents terrorism and enhances security, manages the Nationâ€™s borders, administers immigration laws, safeguards cyberspace, and ensures resilience in the wake of disaster.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Department of Housing and Urban Development (119)
name: [usgovmanual] Department of Housing and Urban Development (119)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Departments
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Department of Housing and Urban Development oversees housing needs nationwide, ensures fair housing opportunities, and creates strong, sustainable, and inclusive communities.
usgovmanual_name: Department of Housing and Urban Development

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Department of Justice (121)
name: [usgovmanual] Department of Justice (121)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Departments
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Department of Justice enforces the law and defends national interests according to the law; ensures public safety against domestic and foreign threats; provides Federal leadership in preventing and controlling crime; seeks just punishment for those who have behaved unlawfully; and ensures fair and impartial administration of justice for all American citizens.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Department of Labor (323)
name: [usgovmanual] Department of Labor (323)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Departments
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Department of Labor promotes the welfare of job seekers, wage earners, and retirees by improving working conditions, advancing opportunities for profitable employment, protecting retirement and health care benefits, matching workers to employers, strengthening free collective bargaining, and tracking changes in economic indicators on a national scale.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Department of State (123)
name: [usgovmanual] Department of State (123)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Departments
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Department of State advises the President on issues of foreign policy; supports democracy, freedom, and prosperity for all people; and fosters conditions that favor stability and progress worldwide.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Department of Transportation (124)
name: [usgovmanual] Department of Transportation (124)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Departments
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Department of Transportation establishes national transportation policy for highway planning and construction, motor carrier safety, urban mass transit, railroads, aviation, and the safety of waterways, ports, highways, and pipelines.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Department of Veterans Affairs (126)
name: [usgovmanual] Department of Veterans Affairs (126)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Departments
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Department of Veterans Affairs operates programs benefiting Veterans and members of their families: It offers education opportunities and rehabilitation services and provides compensation payments for disabilities or death related to military service, home loan guaranties, pensions, burials, and health care that includes the services in clinics, medical centers, community living centers (which replace nursing home)s, and home- and community-based settings.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Department of the Interior (120)
name: [usgovmanual] Department of the Interior (120)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Departments
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Department of the Interior protects America's heritage and natural resources, honors its cultures and tribal communities, and supplies energy for powering its future.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Department of the Treasury (125)
name: [usgovmanual] Department of the Treasury (125)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Departments
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Department of the Treasury enforces financial laws, manufactures coins and currency, and recommends economic, fiscal, and tax policies.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Administrative Conference of the United States (127)
name: [usgovmanual] Administrative Conference of the United States (127)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Administrative Conference of the United States develops recommendations for improving the fairness and effectiveness of procedures by which Federal agencies administer regulatory, benefit, and other Government programs.
usgovmanual_name: Administrative Conference of the United States

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Central Intelligence Agency (130)
name: [usgovmanual] Central Intelligence Agency (130)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Central Intelligence Agency collects, evaluates, and disseminates vital information on economic, military, political, scientific, and other developments abroad to safeguard national security.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Commodity Futures Trading Commission (131)
name: [usgovmanual] Commodity Futures Trading Commission (131)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Commodity Futures Trading Commission avoids systemic risk; fosters open, transparent, competitive, and financially sound markets; and protects the market users and their funds, consumers, and the public from fraud, manipulation, and abusive practices related to derivatives and other products that are subject to the Commodity Exchange Act.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Consumer Product Safety Commission (132)
name: [usgovmanual] Consumer Product Safety Commission (132)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Consumer Product Safety Commission protects the public by reducing the risk of injury and death from consumer products.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (321)
name: [usgovmanual] Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (321)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) helps consumer finance markets work by making rules more effective, by consistently and fairly enforcing those rules, and by empowering consumers to take more control over their economic lives.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Corporation for National and Community Service (133)
name: [usgovmanual] Corporation for National and Community Service (133)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Corporation for National and Community Service improves lives, strengthens communities, and fosters civic engagement through service and volunteering.
usgovmanual_name: Corporation for National and Community Service

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Environmental Protection Agency (135)
name: [usgovmanual] Environmental Protection Agency (135)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Environmental Protection Agency protects human health and safeguards the environment.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Defense Nuclear Facilities Safety Board (134)
name: [usgovmanual] Defense Nuclear Facilities Safety Board (134)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Defense Nuclear Facilities Safety Board identifies the nature and consequences of public health and safety threats at the Department of Energy's defense nuclear facilities, elevates awareness of and information on such threats to the highest levels of governmental authority, and keeps the public informed.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (136)
name: [usgovmanual] Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (136)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Equal Employment Opportunity Commission enforces laws that prohibit employment discrimination based on age, color, disability, gender, genetic information, national origin, race, or religion.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Export-Import Bank of the United States (137)
name: [usgovmanual] Export-Import Bank of the United States (137)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Export-Import Bank helps finance the export of U.S. goods and services to international markets.
usgovmanual_name: Export-Import Bank of the United States

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Farm Credit Administration (138)
name: [usgovmanual] Farm Credit Administration (138)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Farm Credit Administration ensures the safe and sound operation of the banks, associations, affiliated service organizations, and other entities of the Farm Credit System, and protects the interests of the public and those who borrow from Farm Credit institutions or invest in Farm Credit securities.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Federal Communications Commission (139)
name: [usgovmanual] Federal Communications Commission (139)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Federal Communications Commission regulates interstate and foreign communications by radio, television, wire, satellite, and cable.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (140)
name: [usgovmanual] Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (140)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation preserves and promotes public confidence in U.S. financial institutions by insuring bank and thrift deposits, examining State-chartered banks, and liquidating assets of failed institutions.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Federal Election Commission (141)
name: [usgovmanual] Federal Election Commission (141)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Federal Election Commission provides public disclosure of campaign finance activities and ensures compliance with campaign finance laws and regulations.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Federal Labor Relations Authority (143)
name: [usgovmanual] Federal Labor Relations Authority (143)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Federal Labor Relations Authority oversees labor-management relations between the Federal Government and its employees.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Federal Housing Finance Agency (142)
name: [usgovmanual] Federal Housing Finance Agency (142)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Federal Housing and Finance Agency ensures that the housing Government-Sponsored Enterprises operate safely and soundly and serve as a reliable source of liquidity and funding for housing finance and community investment.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Federal Maritime Commission (144)
name: [usgovmanual] Federal Maritime Commission (144)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Federal Maritime Commission promotes an efficient, fair, and reliable supply system of international ocean transportation; protects the public from deceptive, unfair, and unlawful practices; and contributes to the integrity and security of the Nation's supply chain and transportation system.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Federal Mine Safety and Health Review Commission (146)
name: [usgovmanual] Federal Mine Safety and Health Review Commission (146)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Federal Mine Safety and Health Review Commission ensures compliance with occupational safety and health standards in the Nation's surface and underground coal, metal, and nonmetal mines.
usgovmanual_name: Federal Mine Safety and Health Review Commission

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Federal Mediation and Conciliation Service (145)
name: [usgovmanual] Federal Mediation and Conciliation Service (145)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Federal Mediation and Conciliation Service helps labor and management resolve disputes in industries affecting commerce, offers training in cooperative processes to promote workplace stability and economic growth, and provides alternative dispute resolution services, training, negotiated rulemaking, and public policy facilitation to government entities.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Federal Reserve System (147)
name: [usgovmanual] Federal Reserve System (147)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Federal Reserve System keeps the Nation's monetary and financial system flexible, safe, and stable.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Federal Retirement Thrift Investment Board (148)
name: [usgovmanual] Federal Retirement Thrift Investment Board (148)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Federal Retirement Thrift Investment Board administers the Thrift Savings Plan in the interest of its participants and beneficiaries.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Federal Trade Commission (149)
name: [usgovmanual] Federal Trade Commission (149)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Federal Trade Commission protects America's consumers and enforces laws prohibiting anticompetitive, deceptive, or unfair business practices.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] General Services Administration (150)
name: [usgovmanual] General Services Administration (150)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The General Services Administration delivers value and savings in real estate, acquisition, technology, and other mission-support services across Government.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Inter-American Foundation (151)
name: [usgovmanual] Inter-American Foundation (151)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Inter-American Foundation supports social and economic development in Latin America and the Caribbean.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] National Aeronautics and Space Administration (153)
name: [usgovmanual] National Aeronautics and Space Administration (153)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The National Aeronautics and Space Administration advances aeronautic research, explores space, and makes scientific discoveries for the benefit of humankind.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Merit Systems Protection Board (152)
name: [usgovmanual] Merit Systems Protection Board (152)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Merit Systems Protection Board protects the integrity of the Federal personnel merit systems and the rights of Federal employees.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] National Archives and Records Administration (154)
name: [usgovmanual] National Archives and Records Administration (154)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The National Archives and Records Administration safeguards and preserves the records of the U.S. Government and provides public access to them, ensuring that the American people can discover, learn from, and use their documentary heritage to support democracy.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] National Capital Planning Commission (155)
name: [usgovmanual] National Capital Planning Commission (155)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The National Capital Planning Commission conducts planning and development activities for Federal lands and facilities in the National Capital Regionâ€”the District of Columbia, the City of Alexandria, and all land areas within the boundaries of Montgomery, Prince George's, Fairfax, Loudoun, Prince William, and Arlington Counties.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] National Credit Union Administration (156)
name: [usgovmanual] National Credit Union Administration (156)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The National Credit Union Administration provides a trustworthy credit union system that builds confidence in the Nation's system of cooperative credit.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] National Foundation on the Arts and the Humanities (157)
name: [usgovmanual] National Foundation on the Arts and the Humanities (157)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_name: National Foundation on the Arts and the Humanities

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] National Labor Relations Board (158)
name: [usgovmanual] National Labor Relations Board (158)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The National Labor Relations Board remedies unfair labor practices and safeguards employees' rights to organize and to determine whether to have unions as their bargaining representative.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] National Railroad Passenger Corporation (AMTRAK) (160)
name: [usgovmanual] National Railroad Passenger Corporation (AMTRAK) (160)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The National Railroad Passenger Corporation provides intercity rail passenger service in the United States.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] National Mediation Board (159)
name: [usgovmanual] National Mediation Board (159)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The National Mediation Board facilitates labor-management relations within the railroad and airline industries.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] National Science Foundation (161)
name: [usgovmanual] National Science Foundation (161)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The National Science Foundation supports research and education to advance science and engineering.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] National Transportation Safety Board (162)
name: [usgovmanual] National Transportation Safety Board (162)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The National Transportation Safety Board investigates accidents, conducts studies, and makes recommendations on safety to Government agencies, the transportation industry, and others.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Nuclear Regulatory Commission (163)
name: [usgovmanual] Nuclear Regulatory Commission (163)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Nuclear Regulatory Commission licenses and regulates civilian use of nuclear energy to protect public health and safety and the environment.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Occupational Safety and Health Review Commission (164)
name: [usgovmanual] Occupational Safety and Health Review Commission (164)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Occupational Safety and Health Review Commission ensures the timely and fair resolution of cases involving the alleged exposure of American workers to unsafe or unhealthy working conditions.
usgovmanual_name: Occupational Safety and Health Review Commission

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Office of Government Ethics (166)
name: [usgovmanual] Office of Government Ethics (166)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Office of Government Ethics leads and oversees the executive branch program for preventing and resolving conflicts of interest.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Office of Personnel Management (167)
name: [usgovmanual] Office of Personnel Management (167)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Office of Personnel Management administers a merit system to ensure compliance with personnel laws and regulations and assists agencies with recruiting, examining, and promoting on the basis of skills and knowledge irrespective of race, religion, sex, political influence, or other factors not based on merit.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Office of the Director of National Intelligence (165)
name: [usgovmanual] Office of the Director of National Intelligence (165)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Office of the Director of National Intelligence oversees and coordinates the foreign and domestic activities of the Intelligence Community across the Federal Government.
usgovmanual_name: Office of the Director of National Intelligence

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Peace Corps (170)
name: [usgovmanual] Peace Corps (170)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Peace Corps gives the peoples of host countries increased access to volunteers who are qualified, skilled, and trained, and it strengthens mutual understanding between Americans and the peoples of the countries served.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Overseas Private Investment Corporation (169)
name: [usgovmanual] Overseas Private Investment Corporation (169)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Overseas Private Investment Corporation promotes economic growth and job opportunities both at home and abroad by encouraging U.S. private investment in developing countries and emerging markets.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Pension Benefit Guaranty Corporation (171)
name: [usgovmanual] Pension Benefit Guaranty Corporation (171)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Pension Benefit Guaranty Corporation protects the retirement incomes of American workers in private-sector defined benefit pension plans.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Postal Regulatory Commission (172)
name: [usgovmanual] Postal Regulatory Commission (172)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Postal Regulatory Commission develops and implements a modern system of postal rate regulation.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Railroad Retirement Board (173)
name: [usgovmanual] Railroad Retirement Board (173)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Railroad Retirement Board administers comprehensive retirement-survivor and unemployment-sickness benefit programs for the Nation's railroad workers and their families.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Securities and Exchange Commission (174)
name: [usgovmanual] Securities and Exchange Commission (174)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Securities and Exchange Commission protects investors, facilitates capital formation, and maintains efficient, fair, and orderly markets.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Selective Service System (175)
name: [usgovmanual] Selective Service System (175)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Selective Service System supplies the Armed Forces with manpower in an emergency and operates an Alternative Service Program for men classified as conscientious objectors.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Small Business Administration (176)
name: [usgovmanual] Small Business Administration (176)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Small Business Administration aids, assists, and counsels entrepreneurs and protects their business interests; preserves free and competitive enterprise; and maintains and strengthens the overall economy.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Surface Transportation Board (335)
name: [usgovmanual] Surface Transportation Board (335)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Surface Transportation Board adjudicates and resolves railroad rate and service disputes and reviews proposals for railroad mergers.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Social Security Administration (177)
name: [usgovmanual] Social Security Administration (177)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Social Security Administration manages the retirement, survivors, and disability insurance programs that are known as Social Security; it administers the Supplemental Security Income program for the aged, blind, and disabled; and it assigns Social Security numbers to U.S. citizens and maintains earnings records based on those numbers.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Tennessee Valley Authority (178)
name: [usgovmanual] Tennessee Valley Authority (178)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Tennessee Valley Authority conducts a unified program of resource development to advance economic growth in the Tennessee Valley region.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] United States African Development Foundation (128)
name: [usgovmanual] United States African Development Foundation (128)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The United States African Development Foundation provides seed capital and technical assistance to support African-led development that grows community enterprises.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Trade and Development Agency (179)
name: [usgovmanual] Trade and Development Agency (179)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Trade and Development Agency advances economic development and U.S. commercial interest in developing and middle-income countries.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] United States Agency for Global Media (129)
name: [usgovmanual] United States Agency for Global Media (129)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The U.S. Agency for Global Media informs, engages, and connects people around the world in support of freedom and democracy.
usgovmanual_name: United States Agency for Global Media

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] United States Agency for International Development (180)
name: [usgovmanual] United States Agency for International Development (180)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The United States Agency for International Development seeks to eradicate extreme global poverty and enables resilient and democratic societies to realize their potential.
usgovmanual_name: United States Agency for International Development

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] United States Commission on Civil Rights (181)
name: [usgovmanual] United States Commission on Civil Rights (181)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Commission on Civil Rights informs the development of national civil rights policy and enhances enforcement of Federal civil rights laws.
usgovmanual_name: United States Commission on Civil Rights

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] United States International Trade Commission (182)
name: [usgovmanual] United States International Trade Commission (182)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The United States International Trade Commission provides the President, the U.S. Trade Representative, and the Congress with independent analysis of and information on tariffs, international trade, and the Nation's competitiveness; makes determinations in proceedings involving imports that may harm a domestic industry or violate U.S. intellectual property rights; and maintains the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] United States Office of Special Counsel (168)
name: [usgovmanual] United States Office of Special Counsel (168)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The United States Office of Special Counsel investigates allegations of certain activities prohibited by civil service laws, rules, or regulations and litigates before the Merit Systems Protection Board.
usgovmanual_name: United States Office of Special Counsel

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] United States Postal Service (183)
name: [usgovmanual] United States Postal Service (183)
usgovmanual_category: Executive Branch: Independent Agencies and Government Corporations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The United States Postal Service binds the Nation together through the people's personal, educational, literary, and business correspondence by providing prompt, reliable, and efficient services to patrons in all areas and by rendering postal services to all communities.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Legal Services Corporation (185)
name: [usgovmanual] Legal Services Corporation (185)
usgovmanual_category: Quasi-Official Agencies
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Legal Services Corporation promotes equal access to justice and provides civil legal assistance to low-income persons.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Smithsonian Institution (186)
name: [usgovmanual] Smithsonian Institution (186)
usgovmanual_category: Quasi-Official Agencies
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Smithsonian Institution increases the fund of human knowledge and diffuses that knowledge among people.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] State Justice Institute (187)
name: [usgovmanual] State Justice Institute (187)
usgovmanual_category: Quasi-Official Agencies
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The State Justice Institute supports the Nation's judicial system and the public that it serves.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] United States Holocaust Memorial Museum (333)
name: [usgovmanual] United States Holocaust Memorial Museum (333)
usgovmanual_category: Quasi-Official Agencies
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The United States Holocaust Memorial Museum promotes documentation, study, and interpretation of the Holocaust and maintains a permanent living memorial to its victims.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] United States Institute of Peace (188)
name: [usgovmanual] United States Institute of Peace (188)
usgovmanual_category: Quasi-Official Agencies
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The United States Institute of Peace prevents, mitigates, and resolves violent conflicts around the world.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] African Development Bank (189)
name: [usgovmanual] African Development Bank (189)
usgovmanual_category: International Organizations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The African Development Bank reduces poverty in Arica, improves living conditions for Africans, and mobilizes resources for economic and social development throughout the continent.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Asian Development Bank (196)
name: [usgovmanual] Asian Development Bank (196)
usgovmanual_category: International Organizations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Asian Development Bank stimulates sustainable economic development and social progress in member countries to mitigate poverty and its effects.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (237)
name: [usgovmanual] European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (237)
usgovmanual_category: International Organizations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The European Bank for Reconstruction and Development develops open and sustainable market economies in democratic countries.
usgovmanual_name: European Bank for Reconstruction and Development

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Inter-American Defense Board (190)
name: [usgovmanual] Inter-American Defense Board (190)
usgovmanual_category: International Organizations

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Inter-American Development Bank (197)
name: [usgovmanual] Inter-American Development Bank (197)
usgovmanual_category: International Organizations

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Inter-American Investment Corporation (200)
name: [usgovmanual] Inter-American Investment Corporation (200)
usgovmanual_category: International Organizations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Inter-American Development Bank promotes development in Latin America and the Caribbean through the private sector.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] International Monetary Fund (191)
name: [usgovmanual] International Monetary Fund (191)
usgovmanual_category: International Organizations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The International Monetary Fund fosters global monetary cooperation, secures financial stability, facilitates international trade, promotes employment and sustainable economic growth, and reduces poverty worldwide.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] International Organization for Migration (192)
name: [usgovmanual] International Organization for Migration (192)
usgovmanual_category: International Organizations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The International Organization for Migration analyzes and addresses underlying issues of migration; deals with the operational challenges of migration management; promotes economic and social development through migration; and champions the dignity and well-being of migrants, while confronting xenophobic narratives that hurt them.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] Organization of American States (193)
name: [usgovmanual] Organization of American States (193)
usgovmanual_category: International Organizations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The Organization of American States seeks an order of peace and justice among its member states, promotes their solidarity and strengthens their collaboration, and defends their sovereignty, territorial integrity, and independence.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] United Nations (194)
name: [usgovmanual] United Nations (194)
usgovmanual_category: International Organizations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The United Nations supports tolerance and peaceful coexistence among the nations; seeks to maintain peace and security among them; opposes the use of armed force, except in the common interest; and promotes the economic and social advancement of all peoples.

path: /US FEDERAL GOVERNMENT/[usgovmanual] World Bank Group (198)
name: [usgovmanual] World Bank Group (198)
usgovmanual_category: International Organizations
usgovmanual_mission_statement_records_0_: The World Bank Group promotes shared global prosperity and seeks to end extreme poverty.
